data.title: Cannot lookup for the global linked node_modules
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:18:32.269Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.16.0|
|theme-desertex|casualjim|0.0.6|
|vscode-svgviewer|cssho|1.4.0|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.2.8|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|json-tools|eriklynd|1.0.2|
|prettier-vscode|esbenp|0.17.1|
|flow-for-vscode|flowtype|0.6.0|
|vscode-icon-theme|jtlowe|1.5.0|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.61|
|addDocComments|stevencl|0.0.8|
|react-beautify|taichi|0.3.0|;


---
In my project, I create a lib module and linked it to the global module by command `npm link`: (https://docs.npmjs.com/cli/link). But in the editor, I cannot navigate to that module.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create a node module name `my_lib`, make it global by `npm link`
Extra step is to check if it work correctly by `npm -g ls | grep my_lib`
2. In your code, import that lib:
`const my_lib = require('my_lib');`
3. Try to using the inner function, CMD + click, find the function... VSCode cannot navigate to the linked folder.

data.title: Adds "babel" support to <script> tags in html
data.body: text/babel highlighting works with this now in html files.

data.title: Emmet / JSX tag expansion initialization/activation bug
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1 (all extensions disabled)
- OS Version: Windows 10

The ability of JSX tag expansion (Emmet) to function in js/jsx files is dependent on the type of the file first viewed when the VS Code is opened.

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create/open a project with a blank `.js` and a blank `.jsx` file.
2. Open both files.
3. Set the current editor tab to the `.jsx` file.
4. Use the "Reload window" command (or just close and reopen VS Code).
5. Typing something like `div.myclass` and pressing <kbd>Tab</kbd> will expand it into a JSX tag, in both the jsx file and the js file.
6. Set the current editor tab to the `.js` file.
7. Repeat step 4.
8. Typing something like `div.myclass` and pressing <kbd>Tab</kbd> will not work, in either the js file or the jsx file.

This also applies when you close all the editor tabs before reloading, the first file type opened will determine how it behaves.

Note that in both cases, tag expansion *will* work as long as the cursor is placed within a pair of enclosing JSX/HTML tags (I assume because this switches the language scope to `jsx-tags` or whatever). But outside of this scope the aforementioned behavior is observed.

data.title: Apply files.eol setting when saving untitled with a specific mode that has this setting configured
data.body:
This is a feature request to save Linux files with linefeed only and not carriage return. 

Visual Studio Code on Windows 10
Version 1.12.1
Commit f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b
Date 2017-05-04T21:26:50.689Z
Shell 1.6.6
Renderer 56.0.2924.87
Node 7.4.0

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Map a windows drive to a Linux machine (e.g. one sharing drives via samba)
2. Open VSCode on Windows
3. Create a shell script like this:

#!/bin/bash
echo "Hello World!"

4. save the file to the Linux machine: myhello.sh
5. login to Linux machine, chmod +x the file, and try to run it.
6. observe error:

-bash: ./myhello.sh: /bin/bash^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory

the problem could be resolved as described here:

[https://askubuntu.com/questions/304999/not-able-to-execute-a-sh-file-bin-bashm-bad-interpreter](https://askubuntu.com/questions/304999/not-able-to-execute-a-sh-file-bin-bashm-bad-interpreter)

however VSCode is aware that it is a bash shell script, yet even this setting does not resolve the problem:

    "[shellscript]": {
        "files.eol": "\n",
    }

It would be great to have VSCode be able to save Linux files with the appropriate linefeed (only), as desired.

edit: spelling

data.title: VSCode 1.12.1 standard c# snippets quit working after update
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.12.1 (f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b, 2017-05-04T21:18:32.269Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.5.0
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|vscode-clock|Compulim|0.0.1|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.9.3|
|beautify|HookyQR|1.0.2|
|markdown-checkbox|PKief|1.0.2|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.14|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|git-easy|bibhasdn|1.9.1|
|githistory|donjayamanne|0.2.0|
|python|donjayamanne|0.6.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.15.0|
|vscode-npm-script|eg2|0.1.9|
|rest-client|humao|0.14.3|
|csharpextensions|jchannon|1.3.0|
|Angular2|johnpapa|2.2.3|
|Go|lukehoban|0.6.61|
|markdown-shortcuts|mdickin|0.8.1|
|vscode-todo-parser|minhthai|1.8.10|
|mssql|ms-mssql|1.0.0|
|**csharp**|**ms-vscode**|**1.9.0**|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|3.1.1|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.7.0|
|yo|samverschueren|0.9.3|
|JavaScriptSnippets|xabikos|1.4.0|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open .cs file containing a C# class
2. Notice other features of the extension are functioning: Syntax Highlighting, IntelliSense, Go to Definition, Find All References, .NET Core Attach debugging, etc.
3. The extension is installed (see list above) in ~/.vscode/extensions/ms-vscode.csharp-1.9.0/
4. The snippets file exists in the snippets sub-dir as csharp.json
5. Common snippets like "prop", "namespace", etc. simply do not appear.
6. Note the "class" snippet does show up in the intellisense list but produces bad output:
```
    class Name
    {
    
    ,
    }|<== the cursor is left here after specifying the class name and hitting return
```
7. "foreach" snippet does the same thing:
```
            foreach (var item in collection)
            {
            
            ,
            }|<== the cursor is left here after specifying var, item and collection and hitting return
```
8. Command-Shift-p and "Insert Snippet" shows the snippets that will show up in context; all of the ones I tried from the list had the same formatting issues.
9. Here is what I see from csharp.json for the "class" snippet.
```
        "Class": {

                "prefix": "class",
                "body": [
                        "class ${Name}",
                        "{",
                        "       $0",
                        "}"
                ],
                "description": "Class"
        },
```
Given this I suspect there are some syntax errors in this file. But see below - it appears that is not the whole story.

_Note I did try to re-compile the extension in hopes that the json file would be regenerated somehow. But after npm i and doing npm run compile I got an error about missing tsconfig.json file and then also noticed there was no source delivered with the extension. So I stopped there._

Note the csharp.json file had not changed since Oct 2016 - there were 2 commits recently:
[csharp.json commmits](https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/commits/master/snippets/csharp.json)

There are several issues opened in the OmniSharp repo - [#1459](https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/issues/1459) is just one. So treat this as an FYI.

However they do reference [MS VSCode #26101](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/26101) as part of the problem.

The [OmniSharp VSCode #1464](https://github.com/OmniSharp/omnisharp-vscode/issues/1464) issue was closed on May 8 by Dustin Campbell with a reference to MS #26101.

I am hoping you and the OmniSharp folks can fix this soon. It is impactful to snippets across all extensions.

data.title: CompletionItemProvider#resolve not always called
data.body:
- VSCode Version:
```
$ code --version
1.12.1
f6868fce3eeb16663840eb82123369dec6077a9b
```

- OS Version: Ubuntu 14.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install the extension from this vsix file:  https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/s3-test.spring.io/sts4/vscode-extensions/snapshots/vscode-concourse-0.0.6-RC.1.vsix 
2. Create a file called 'pipeline.yml' and put this text in it:

```
resources:
- name: demo-repo
  type: git
  source:
    uri: git@github.com/kdvolder/demo-repo
    <*>
```

3. The `<*>` marks the cursor/caret position. So delete it and place cursor there.

4. Press CTRL-SPACE to invoke content assist.

Now, in order to see the problem. Only use the mouse to invoke the last proposal in the list. I.e **Do not** use the cursor keys, also *Do no* type to narrow the proposals. Instead, scroll-down (using mouse or scrollwheel) to the last proposal its text is `← ← - name`. Then **click** the proposal with the mouse to invoke it.

=> Observe: The completion simply inserts the label text. So the editor contents becomes this:

```
resources:
- name: demo-repo
  type: git
  source:
    uri: git@github.com/kdvolder/demo-repo
    ← ← - name
```

This is wrong. Compare this to the intended/correct behaviour which you can get by using cursor keys (instead of mouse) to move down and select the proposal, then press `ENTER` to invoke it. In this case the editor contents becomes this:

```
resources:
- name: demo-repo
  type: git
  source:
    uri: git@github.com/kdvolder/demo-repo
- name: 
```

I speculate that the reason for the discrepancy is as follows:

1. our completions must be resolved to get the doc-string as well as fill in the edit. 
2. When we use cursor navigation the doc-strings are revealed in the UI, and this forces the details, including the edits to be filled in.
3. When we directly click on a completion, then its doc string is never revealed and the item is therefore not being resolved. Thus, the item being invoked doesn't have a textEdit and Vscode just defaults to inserting the label text at the cursor instead.

data.title: [FR] Add support for multi range diagnostics
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4

Some diagnostics require more than a single range in a file (or multiple files), e.g. when you have a duplicate symbol and want to show the previous definition of it. You can work around this by adding 2 diagnostics with the same details but different ranges. But once you need 3 or more ranges things look ugly, especially in the problems list where the duplicate diagnostics show up.

data.title: Typescript IntelliSense Error
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: MacOS: 10.12.4 (16E195)

I am using VSCode for D3js visualization development. The problem is using the newest (1.12.1) VSCode, I find the IntelliSense is missing in Typescript. When I reopen the project, the IntelliSense appears but disappears some time later (several minutes).  The bug is strange, because it only appears in some of my projects. I do not know why. Now, I rollback to 1.11.2, the problem is missing. Is there anyone who could help me resolve this issue? Thanks.

Steps to Reproduce:
It is hard to reproduce the problem. So I only show one of the code that causes this problem.


```ts
///<reference path="GlobalData.ts" />
///<reference path="ImgGallery.ts" />
///<reference path="ScatterPlotSeries.ts" />

namespace UIs {
    export class ScatterPlot {
        private dataItems: Array<{x:number, y:number, fre:number, xVal:number, yVal:number}>;
        private emptyDataItems: Array<{x:number, y:number}> = [];
        private coorXYMapper: Array<Array<Array<RectData>>>;
        private imgGallery: ImgGallery;
        private imgThreshold: number;
        private scatterPlotSeries: ScatterPlotSeries;
        private attrX: string;
        private attrY: string;
        private globalData: GlobalData;
        private zoomThreshold = 12;
        private zoomStatus = 0;
        private selectedRectIDs: number[];
        private clickedPoint = {this: null, opacity: 0};

        public svgMain: d3.Selection<any, any, any, any>;
        public svgZoom: d3.Selection<any, any, any, any>;
        private gridLength: number;
        private gridNum: number = 60;
        private xScale: d3.ScaleLinear<number, number>;
        private yScale: d3.ScaleLinear<number, number>;
        private xAxisScale: d3.ScaleLinear<number, number>;
        private yAxisScale: d3.ScaleLinear<number, number>;
        private svgWidth: number = 800;
        private svgHeight: number = 800;
        private width: number;
        private height: number;
        private margin = {top: 20, left: 70, bottom: 20, right: 40};
        // private opacityScale: d3.ScaleQuantile<number>;
        private opacityScale: d3.ScaleLinear<number, number>;
        private epsilon: number = 0.000007;
        private svgTemp: d3.Selection<any, any, any, any>;

        private xAxis: d3.Axis<any>;
        private yAxis: d3.Axis<any>;
        private svgXAxis: d3.Selection<any, any, any, any>;
        private svgYAxis: d3.Selection<any, any, any, any>;

        constructor(_data: Array<RectData>, _globalData: GlobalData, _scatterPlotSeris: ScatterPlotSeries, _svgMain: d3.Selection<any, any, any, any>) {
            this.globalData = _globalData;
            this.scatterPlotSeries = _scatterPlotSeris;
            this.svgMain = _svgMain;
            this.Initialization(_data);
            this.dataItems = this.DataTransform(_data);
            this.Draw();
            CustomizedCrossFilter(_globalData.scatterPlotData, _globalData.attrX, _globalData.attrY, this.scatterPlotSeries.currentState);
        }

        private Initialization(_data: Array<RectData>) {
            this.imgThreshold = this.scatterPlotSeries.imgThreshold;
            this.svgWidth = this.scatterPlotSeries.svgWidth;
            this.svgHeight = this.scatterPlotSeries.svgHeight;
            this.attrX = this.scatterPlotSeries.attrX;
            this.attrY = this.scatterPlotSeries.attrY;

            this.height = this.svgHeight - this.margin.top - this.margin.bottom;
            this.width = this.svgWidth - this.margin.left - this.margin.right;
            this.gridLength = this.width / this.gridNum;
            let xDataExtent = d3.extent(_data, (d) => { return d.xVal; } );
            let yDataExtent = d3.extent(_data, (d) => { return d.yVal; } );

            this.xScale = d3.scaleLinear()
                .range([0, this.gridNum - 1])
                .domain(xDataExtent);
            this.xAxisScale = d3.scaleLinear()
                .domain(xDataExtent)
                .range([0, this.width]);

            this.yScale = d3.scaleLinear()
                .range([this.gridNum - 1, 0])
                .domain(yDataExtent);
            this.yAxisScale = d3.scaleLinear()
                .domain(yDataExtent)
                .range([this.height, 0]);

            // let opacitySteps = [0.1], step = 0.1;
            // for (let i = 0; i < Math.floor(0.9/step); i++)
            //     opacitySteps.push(opacitySteps[i] + step);
            // this.opacityScale = d3.scaleQuantile()
            //     .range(opacitySteps);
            this.opacityScale = d3.scaleLinear()
                .range([0.1, 1]);
        }

        private DataTransform(_data: Array<RectData>) {
            let dataItems: Array<{x: number, y:number, fre: number, xVal:number, yVal: number}> = [];
            let opacityExtent = [Infinity, -Infinity];
            this.coorXYMapper = [];
            for (let i = 0; i < this.gridNum; i++) {
                this.coorXYMapper.push([]);
                for (let j = 0; j < this.gridNum; j++)
                    this.coorXYMapper[i].push(null);
            }

            for (let i = 0; i < _data.length; i++) {
                let x = Math.floor(this.xScale(_data[i].xVal));
                let y = Math.floor(this.yScale(_data[i].yVal));
                if (this.coorXYMapper[x][y] == null)
                        this.coorXYMapper[x][y] = [];
                this.coorXYMapper[x][y].push(_data[i]);
            }

            for (let i = 0; i < this.gridNum; i++)
                for (let j = 0; j < this.gridNum; j++)
                    if (this.coorXYMapper[i][j] != null) {
                        dataItems.push({x: i, y: j, fre: this.coorXYMapper[i][j].length,
                            xVal: this.coorXYMapper[i][j][0].xVal,
                            yVal: this.coorXYMapper[i][j][0].yVal });
                        for (let k = 0; k < this.coorXYMapper[i][j].length; k++)
                            this.coorXYMapper[i][j][k].rectIdx = dataItems.length - 1;
                        opacityExtent[0] = Math.min(opacityExtent[0], this.coorXYMapper[i][j].length);
                        opacityExtent[1] = Math.max(opacityExtent[1], this.coorXYMapper[i][j].length);
                    } else this.emptyDataItems.push({x: i, y: j});
                    
            opacityExtent[0] -= this.epsilon;
            this.opacityScale.domain(opacityExtent);
            // this.opacityScale.domain(Array.from(dataItems, (d) => { return d.fre} ));
            return dataItems;
        }

        private LoadImgs(selectedRectIDs: number[], prefix: string) {
            this.svgZoom.append("g")
                .selectAll(".images")
                .data(selectedRectIDs).enter()
                .append("pattern")
                .attr("id", (d, i) => { return "ScatterMeanImg" + i; } )
                //10 is also OK, but 20 is a little blur and this.gridSize is very blur.
                //I guess with the increase of width, it becomes blurer I cannot understand it.
                .attr("width", 1)
                .attr("height", 1)
                .append("image")
                .attr("xlink:href", (d, i) => { return "static/temp_data/" + prefix + "scatter_mean_img_" + i + ".jpg"; } )
                .attr("width", this.gridLength)
                .attr("height", this.gridLength);
            for (let i in selectedRectIDs) {
                let rect = d3.select("#Rect" + this.scatterPlotSeries.currentState + 'd' + selectedRectIDs[i]);
                rect.style("fill-opacity", 1)
                    .style("fill", "url(#ScatterMeanImg" + i + ")");
                if (this.dataItems[this.selectedRectIDs[i]].fre > 1)
                    rect.style("stroke-width", 0.1)
                        .style("stroke", "red");
            }
        }

        private Draw() {
            let zoomController = d3.zoom()
                .scaleExtent([0.37, this.gridNum / 1.2])
                .on("zoom", this.Zoom());

            this.svgZoom = this.svgMain.append("g")
                .attr("transform", "translate(" + this.margin.left + "," + this.margin.top + ")");

            // let svgBackground =  this.svgZoom.append("svg:rect")
            //     .attr("class", "border")
            //     .attr("width", this.width)
            //     .attr("height", this.height)
            //     .style("stroke", "black")
            //     .attr("pointer-events", "all")
            //     .style("fill", "none");

            this.svgZoom.append("clipPath")
                .attr("id", "RectsClip")
                .append("rect")
                .attr("width", this.width)
                .attr("height", this.height);

            let svgTemp1 = this.svgZoom.append("g")
                .attr("clip-path", "url(#RectsClip)")
                .append("g");
            this.svgTemp = svgTemp1.append("g");
            this.svgTemp.selectAll(".rects")
                .data(this.dataItems).enter()
                .append("rect")
                .attr("class", "RectGroups" + this.scatterPlotSeries.currentState)
                .attr("id", (d, i) => { return "Rect" + this.scatterPlotSeries.currentState + 'd' + i; } )
                .attr("x", (d) => { return d.x * this.gridLength; } )
                .attr("y", (d) => { return d.y * this.gridLength; } )
                .on("mouseover", function() {
                    if (d3.select(this).style("fill").indexOf("url") == -1)
                        d3.select(this).style("fill", "red").style("fill-opacity", 1);
                } )
                .on("mouseout", this.RectMouseOut() )
                .on("click", this.ScatterPlotClick() )  //No need to write like this
                .attr("width", this.gridLength)
                .attr("height", this.gridLength)
                .style("fill-opacity", (d) => { return this.opacityScale(d.fre); })
                .style("fill", "blue")
                .append("title")
                .text((d) => { return this.attrX +  ": " + d.xVal + ";\n" + this.attrY + ":" + d.yVal + ";\n#Samples: " + d.fre; });
            this.svgTemp.selectAll(".emptyRects")
                .data(this.emptyDataItems).enter()
                .append("rect")
                .attr("x", (d) => { return d.x * this.gridLength; } )
                .attr("y", (d) => { return d.y * this.gridLength; } )
                .style("fill-opacity", 0)
                .attr("width", this.gridLength)
                .attr("height", this.gridLength);

            this.DrawAxes();
            // Translation
            // this.svgMain.call(zoomController)
            //     .call(zoomController.translateBy, this.margin.left, this.margin.top);
            svgTemp1.call(zoomController);
        }

        private DrawAxes() {
            //Draw X,Y Axises
            this.xAxis = d3.axisBottom(this.xAxisScale);
            this.yAxis = d3.axisLeft(this.yAxisScale);

            this.svgXAxis = this.svgZoom.append("g")
                .attr("transform", "translate(0," + this.height + ")")
                .attr("class", "x axis")
                .call(this.xAxis);
            this.svgXAxis.append("text")
                .attr("x", this.width)
                .attr("dy", "0.71em")
                .attr("fill", "#000")
                .text("X Dim");
            this.svgYAxis = this.svgZoom.append("g")
                .attr("class", "y axis")
                .call(this.yAxis);
            this.svgYAxis.append("text")
                .attr("dy", "0.71em")
                .attr("fill", "#000")
                .text("Y Dim");
        }

        private Zoom() {
            return () => {
                this.svgTemp.attr("transform", d3.event.transform);
                this.svgXAxis.call(this.xAxis.scale(d3.event.transform.rescaleX(this.xAxisScale)));
                this.svgYAxis.call(this.yAxis.scale(d3.event.transform.rescaleY(this.yAxisScale)));

                let selectedRect: Array<{x: number, y: number}> = [];
                let selectedRectIDs: number[] = [];
                if (d3.event.transform.k > this.zoomThreshold && this.zoomStatus == 0) {
                    this.zoomStatus = 1;
                    for (let i = 0; i < this.dataItems.length; i++) {
                        let x = this.dataItems[i].x * this.gridLength * d3.event.transform.k + d3.event.transform.x;
                        let y = this.dataItems[i].y * this.gridLength * d3.event.transform.k + d3.event.transform.y;
                        if (x >= 0 && x <= this.width && y >= 0 && y <= this.height) {
                            selectedRect.push({x: this.dataItems[i].x, y: this.dataItems[i].y});
                            selectedRectIDs.push(i);
                        }
                    }
                    this.selectedRectIDs = selectedRectIDs;
                    let dataSent = Array.from(selectedRect, (d) => { return Array.from(this.coorXYMapper[d.x][d.y], (e) => { return e.idx; } ); });
                    let xhttp = new XMLHttpRequest();
                    xhttp.onreadystatechange = () => {
                        if (xhttp.readyState == 4 && xhttp.status == 200) {
                            let prefix: string = xhttp.responseText.substring(1, xhttp.responseText.length - 2);
                            this.LoadImgs(selectedRectIDs, prefix);
                        }
                    };
                    xhttp.open("POST", "/scatter_mean_img", true);
                    xhttp.setRequestHeader("Content-Type", "application/json");
                    xhttp.send(JSON.stringify(dataSent));
                }

                if (this.zoomStatus == 1 && d3.event.transform.k < this.zoomThreshold) {
                    this.zoomStatus = 0;
                    for (let i in this.selectedRectIDs) {
                        let rect = d3.select("#Rect" + this.scatterPlotSeries.currentState + 'd' + this.selectedRectIDs[i]);
                        rect.style("fill-opacity", this.opacityScale(this.dataItems[this.selectedRectIDs[i]].fre))
                            .style("fill", "blue");
                        if (this.dataItems[this.selectedRectIDs[i]].fre > 1)
                            rect.style("stroke-width", 0);
                    }
                }
            };
        }

        private RectMouseOut() {
            let This = this;
            return function(d: {x:number, y:number, fre:number, xVal:number, yVal:number}) {
                if (This.clickedPoint != this) {
                    if (d3.select(this).style("fill").indexOf("url") != -1)
                        return;
                    d3.select(this)
                        .style("fill-opacity", This.opacityScale(d.fre))
                        .style("fill", "blue");
                }
            };
        }

        private ScatterPlotClick() {
            let This = this;
            return function(d: {x:number, y:number, fre:number, xVal:number, yVal:number}, i) {
                console.log("Hello", i);
                if (This.clickedPoint.this) {
                    d3.select(This.clickedPoint.this)
                        .style("fill-opacity", This.opacityScale(This.clickedPoint.opacity))
                        .style("fill", "blue");
                }
                d3.select(this)
                    .style("fill-opacity", 1)
                    .style("fill", "red");
                This.clickedPoint = {this: this, opacity: d.fre};
                if (This.coorXYMapper[d.x][d.y].length > This.imgThreshold) {
                    console.log(This.imgThreshold);
                    This.scatterPlotSeries.NewScatterPlot(This.coorXYMapper[d.x][d.y]);
                } else {
                    This.imgGallery = new ImgGallery(This.coorXYMapper[d.x][d.y], This.globalData);
                }
            };
        }
    }
}

declare function CustomizedCrossFilter(_data: Array<UIs.RectData>, _attrX: string, _attrY: string, _index: number): void;
```

data.title: a bug with "Dvorak - QWERTY ⌘" layout
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: Version 1.12.1 (1.12.1)
- OS Version: macOS 10.12.4 (Sierra)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. add a `Dvorak - QWERTY ⌘` keyboard layout
2. press `⌘ + any-key` , It's still using Dvorak not QWERTY
>e.g.
press `⌘J`, it should be `⌘C`, but in vscode, it is still `⌘J`

data.title: feat: Terminal, option to change to change default integrated shell in terminal menu
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

It would be great if there was an option to switch terminals in the terminal menu (top right side).
![d](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7036770/26030745/8e92bcaa-3879-11e7-8aee-b08a8a32d710.PNG)
Either as a drop-down to the `+` (New terminal) button or as a separate one.

Currently only way to do this quickly is using command pallete.

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Home

data.title: Lag when editing code while WebGL is open in Chrome
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open a tab rendering rather heavy WebGL, keep it as the focused tab
2. Go to VSCode, try to edit (scroll around, type) a file

I'm not sure if this is a bug, as I'm not sure why Chrome's performance should affect VSCode's. I'm using the latest version, but I noticed this as well on older versions.

data.title: Same column (and line) twice with word wrap enabled
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro (1703)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open new window, write on first line **abcdefghijklmnopqrstuvwxyz** and make that line wrap to next one.
2. Now, with cursor at the start of the alphabet, you should press right arrow 26 times to reach the end. But actually, it must be hit 27 times, which is confusing...

Maybe, better explanation with images...
![1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3635737/26030024/66cfd48e-3845-11e7-95f6-f6b070a9d71e.png)
_Column 25, cursor at the first line._

![2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/3635737/26030025/69ad70a8-3845-11e7-8935-6bfa698ad1ce.png)
_Column 25, cursor at the second line._

data.title: https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/vscode/ is inaccessible
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.12.1
- OS Version: linux mint 18.1

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Connect the client machine to an algo VPN hosted in the aws eu-west-1 Ireland data centre
2. Attempt to check for vscode updates with the linux mint update manager and watch it hang for ages when trying to connect to the vscode repo and then witness it eventually fail
3. Attempt to navigate to https://packages.microsoft.com/repos/vscode/ in a browser and watch it hang and fail
4. Disconnect from the VPN and verify it works

Any ideas? Is this url geo-blocked?

data.title: Marked brackets range on scrollbar
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.12.1
- OS Version:Linux

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Click on the code, inside the brackets.
2. Marked brackets range on scrollbar.
Internal bracket marked with a main color.
External brackets in gray (all). Same with more nesting brackets.
![brackets-range-on-scrollbar](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16800535/26028968/9dececb0-382a-11e7-814b-fff32eecd0be.png)
3. As soon as one brackets, it's just the main color.
![brackets-range-on-scrollbar2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/16800535/26028965/97c3ada6-382a-11e7-81fa-c72370054c10.png)


This will be very useful. Particularly for longer code blocks, so that you can easily see where it ends and where it starts.
